abstract: The activist hedge fund manager makes jokes but warns about the financial system.
snippet: The activist hedge fund manager makes jokes but warns about the financial system.
lead_paragraph: There are few on Wall Street who can captivate an audience like the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn. On Tuesday, the activist hedge fund manager, who has drawn ire from corporate America for his abrasive manner with corporate chieftains, entertained once again.

headline.main: Carl Icahn Talks Investments, Trump and a ‘Minefield’

abstract: It is the latest in a string of settlements over sanctions violations as regulators take aim at banks for doing business with blacklisted countries.
snippet: It is the latest in a string of settlements over sanctions violations as regulators take aim at banks for doing business with blacklisted countries.
lead_paragraph: Deutsche Bank agreed on Wednesday to pay $258 million and fire six employees to resolve investigations by state and federal banking regulators into its dealings with countries like Iran and Syria in violation of United States sanctions laws.

headline.main: Deutsche Bank to Pay $258 Million and Fire 6 in Settlement
headline.print_headline: Deutsche Bank to Pay $258 Million and Fire 6

abstract: MyRA is aimed at people who have no retirement plan at work and lets them have money deducted from their paychecks or make electronic transfers.
snippet: MyRA is aimed at people who have no retirement plan at work and lets them have money deducted from their paychecks or make electronic transfers.
lead_paragraph: After an extended test period, the federal government is widely promoting its new savings plan called myRA, which is aimed at people who do not have a retirement plan at work.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Account to Encourage Retirement Saving
headline.print_headline: U.S. Offers Account to Encourage Retirement Saving
